Ltd. |Ship laid down= 22 September 1939 |Ship launched= 28 November 1940 |Ship completed=30 August 1941 |Ship commissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship fate=Sunk by torpedo, 10 November 1942 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class= [[Black Swan class sloop|''Black Swan''-class]] [[sloop-of-war|sloop]] |Ship displacement= |Ship length= |Ship beam= |Ship draught= |Ship propulsion= |Ship sail plan= |Ship speed= |Ship range= |Ship complement= |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament= |Ship armour= |Ship notes= }} |} '''HMS ''Ibis'' (U99)''' was a [[Black Swan class sloop|''Black Swan''-class]] [[sloop-of-war|sloop]] of the [[Royal Navy]], named after the [[Ibis]]. ''Ibis'', built by Furness Shipbuilding Co. Ltd., [[Haverton Hill|Haverton Hill-on-Tees]], [[County Durham|Co. Durham]], was laid down on 22 September 1939, launched on 28 November 1940, and completed 30 August 1941. ''Ibis'' was sunk by an [[airborne torpedo]] from an [[Regia Aeronautica|Italian aircraft]] in the Western [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean]], north of [[Algiers]] on 10 November 1942. ==Notes== {{reflist|2}} ==References== * {{cite book|last=Hague|first=Arnold|title=Sloops: A History of the 71 Sloops Built in Britain and Australia for the British, Australian and Indian Navies 1926â€“1946|year=1993|publisher=World Ship Society|location=Kendal, England|isbn=0-905617-67-3}} {{coord|37|0|N|3|0|E|display=title}} {{Black Swan class sloop}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ibis}} [[Category:Tees-built ships]] [[Category:Black Swan-class sloops]] [[Category:World War II sloops of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Sloops of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:World War II shipwrecks in the Mediterranean]] [[Category:Ships sunk by aircraft]] [[Category:1940 ships]] [[Category:Maritime incidents in 1942]] {{UK-mil-ship-stub}}
